metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33098 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Improper input validation in the Intel(R) Ethernet ixgbe driver for Linux before version 3.17.3 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via local access. Asaf Modelevsky discovered that the Intel(R) Ethernet ixgbe driver for the Linux kernel did not properly validate large MTU requests from Virtual Function (VF) devices. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33098` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1138-aws - 4.4.0-1138.152
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1109-aws - 4.15.0-1109.116~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: seth-arnold> We don't yet know if this affects Ubuntu Linux.

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1138.152').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1109.116~16.04.1').

linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1106.120~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1103.112').
